lessons.title: What is a Computer Keyboard?
lessons.content:
A computer keyboard is an input device that allows users to type letters, numbers, and commands into a computer.

ðŸ‘‰ It is essential for writing documents, entering data, and controlling software.
ðŸ‘‰ Keyboards can be physical or on-screen.

lessons.title: Layout of the Keyboard
lessons.content:
Most keyboards use the **QWERTY layout**. Keys are grouped into different sections: letters, numbers, function keys, navigation keys, and special keys.

ðŸ‘‰ QWERTY layout helps users type quickly and accurately.
ðŸ‘‰ Some keyboards have alternative layouts like AZERTY or DVORAK.

lessons.title: Categories of Keys
lessons.content:
Keyboard keys are divided into several categories:
â€¢ **Alphanumeric keys**: letters and numbers
â€¢ **Function keys (F1â€“F12)**: perform special tasks
â€¢ **Control keys**: Ctrl, Alt, Esc
â€¢ **Navigation keys**: Arrows, Home, End
â€¢ **Numeric keypad**: numbers and symbols
â€¢ **Special keys**: Enter, Shift, Spacebar, Backspace

lessons.title: How to Use the Keyboard for Typing
lessons.content:
Typing skills help you write quickly and accurately.

ðŸ‘‰ Place your fingers on the **home row keys** (A, S, D, F for left hand, J, K, L, ; for right hand).
ðŸ‘‰ Thumbs rest on the **spacebar**.
ðŸ‘‰ Keep fingers curved and use the correct finger for each key.
ðŸ‘‰ Practice improves speed and accuracy.

lessons.title: Function Keys (F1â€“F12)
lessons.content:
Function keys are located at the top of the keyboard and perform special functions depending on the program.

ðŸ‘‰ **F1**: Help â€“ opens help menu in most programs.
ðŸ‘‰ **F2**: Rename â€“ rename selected files or items.
ðŸ‘‰ **F3**: Search â€“ opens search function in many applications.
ðŸ‘‰ **F4**: Address bar / Close window â€“ Alt + F4 closes the current window.
ðŸ‘‰ **F5**: Refresh â€“ reloads the page or document.
ðŸ‘‰ **F6**: Move cursor â€“ cycles through elements in a window or browser.
ðŸ‘‰ **F7**: Spell check â€“ opens spelling and grammar check in Word.
ðŸ‘‰ **F8**: Boot menu â€“ used in some systems to access startup options.
ðŸ‘‰ **F9**: Refresh document / Send & Receive email in Outlook.
ðŸ‘‰ **F10**: Menu activation â€“ activates the menu bar in many apps.
ðŸ‘‰ **F11**: Full screen â€“ toggles full-screen mode in browsers.
ðŸ‘‰ **F12**: Save As â€“ opens the Save As dialog in most programs.

Some applications assign unique tasks to function keys based on software design.

lessons.title: Numeric and Symbol Keys
lessons.content:
Numeric keys are used to type numbers. Symbol keys allow punctuation and special characters.

ðŸ‘‰ Press **Shift + number keys** for symbols (!, @, #, $ etc.).
ðŸ‘‰ The numeric keypad helps type numbers quickly, especially in calculations.

lessons.title: Home Row Keys
lessons.content:
The **home row** is where your fingers rest when typing.

ðŸ‘‰ Left hand: A, S, D, F
ðŸ‘‰ Right hand: J, K, L, ;
ðŸ‘‰ Thumbs rest on the spacebar.
ðŸ‘‰ From this position, you reach all other keys quickly.

lessons.title: Top Row Keys
lessons.content:
The top row contains the letters **Q to P**.

ðŸ‘‰ Accessed by stretching fingers from the home row.
ðŸ‘‰ Includes numbers and symbols above the letters.

lessons.title: Bottom Row Keys
lessons.content:
The bottom row has letters **Z, X, C, V, B, N, M**.

ðŸ‘‰ Typed by stretching fingers down from the home row.
ðŸ‘‰ Also includes punctuation keys like comma and period.

lessons.title: Punctuation Keys
lessons.content:
Punctuation keys are important for writing sentences.

ðŸ‘‰ **Comma (,)** and **period (.)** end sentences.
ðŸ‘‰ **Question mark (?)** and **exclamation mark (!)** show feelings.
ðŸ‘‰ Use punctuation correctly to make writing clear.

lessons.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
lessons.content:
Shortcuts help you work faster.

ðŸ‘‰ **Ctrl + C** = Copy
ðŸ‘‰ **Ctrl + V** = Paste
ðŸ‘‰ **Ctrl + X** = Cut
ðŸ‘‰ **Ctrl + Z** = Undo
ðŸ‘‰ **Ctrl + S** = Save

Practice shortcuts to save time while working.

lessons.title: What is a Computer Mouse?
lessons.content:
A computer mouse is a pointing device used to interact with items on the screen.

ðŸ‘‰ Move the pointer to select icons, buttons, and menus.
ðŸ‘‰ Click, drag, and scroll to control the computer efficiently.

lessons.title: Types of Computer Mouse
lessons.content:
There are different types of mice for different purposes:
â€¢ **Optical Mouse**: Uses light to detect movement.
â€¢ **Wireless Mouse**: Connects without a cable.
â€¢ **Trackball Mouse**: Moves pointer by rotating a ball.
â€¢ **Gaming Mouse**: Extra buttons and higher sensitivity for games.

lessons.title: Mouse Buttons and Their Uses
lessons.content:
A standard mouse has several buttons:
â€¢ **Left button**: Select items, click links.
â€¢ **Right button**: Opens context menus.
â€¢ **Scroll wheel**: Moves page up/down.
â€¢ **Additional buttons**: For extra functions or gaming shortcuts.

lessons.title: Mouse Actions
lessons.content:
Common mouse actions include:
â€¢ **Single click** â€“ select an item
â€¢ **Double click** â€“ open files or programs
â€¢ **Drag and drop** â€“ move objects
â€¢ **Scroll** â€“ navigate pages
â€¢ **Right click** â€“ open menus

lessons.title: Drag and Drop
lessons.content:
Dragging means holding down the mouse button while moving an object.

ðŸ‘‰ Used to move files, icons, or text.
ðŸ‘‰ Always release the button to drop the item in the new location.

lessons.title: Scrolling with the Mouse
lessons.content:
Scrolling allows you to move up and down a document or web page.

ðŸ‘‰ Use the scroll wheel or trackpad.
ðŸ‘‰ Scrolling is helpful for reading long content.

lessons.title: Clicking Basics
lessons.content:
Clicking is pressing and releasing a mouse button quickly.

ðŸ‘‰ **Single click**: Select an item.
ðŸ‘‰ **Double click**: Open a file or folder.
ðŸ‘‰ Use your **index finger** for left click.

lessons.title: Clicking and Dragging
lessons.content:
Dragging means holding a button while moving the mouse.

ðŸ‘‰ Used to move objects, highlight text, or draw shapes.
ðŸ‘‰ Release the button when done.

lessons.title: High-Speed Precision Tasks
lessons.content:
Some activities require fast and accurate mouse movement.

ðŸ‘‰ Practice moving the pointer to small targets.
ðŸ‘‰ Click quickly but carefully.
ðŸ‘‰ Helps in gaming and graphic design.

lessons.title: Mouse Practice Activities
lessons.content:
Practice exercises help improve speed and accuracy:
â€¢ Clicking on targets
â€¢ Dragging objects
â€¢ Scrolling lists

ðŸ‘‰ Start with simple exercises and progress to complex tasks.

lessons.title: What is a Computer?
lessons.content:
A computer is an electronic device that receives, processes, and stores data.

ðŸ‘‰ Computers perform tasks quickly and accurately.
ðŸ‘‰ They can be used for learning, gaming, research, and communication.

lessons.title: Parts of a Computer
lessons.content:
A computer has several important parts:
â€¢ **CPU**: Brain of the computer, processes data.
â€¢ **Monitor**: Displays information.
â€¢ **Keyboard**: Input device for typing.
â€¢ **Mouse**: Controls pointer on the screen.
â€¢ **Storage**: Saves files and programs.
â€¢ **Speakers**: Output sound.

lessons.title: Uses of a Computer
lessons.content:
Computers are useful in many areas:
â€¢ **Education**: Learning and research.
â€¢ **Gaming**: Entertainment and skill development.
â€¢ **Office Work**: Writing documents, calculations.
â€¢ **Communication**: Emails, video calls.
â€¢ **Research**: Gathering and analyzing information.

lessons.title: Safe Use of Computers
lessons.content:
Always follow safety guidelines:
â€¢ Keep your screen at eye level.
â€¢ Take regular breaks to avoid strain.
â€¢ Use strong passwords.
â€¢ Ask an adult before downloading files or visiting websites.
â€¢ Avoid sharing personal information online.

lessons.title: Introduction to Coding
lessons.content:
Coding is giving instructions to a computer to perform tasks.

ðŸ‘‰ Start with simple programs to understand logic and commands.
ðŸ‘‰ Coding can be fun and creative.

lessons.title: Scratch and Block Coding
lessons.content:
Scratch uses visual blocks to teach coding concepts to kids.

ðŸ‘‰ Drag and drop blocks to make characters move, jump, or perform actions.
ðŸ‘‰ Learn sequencing, loops, and events easily.

lessons.title: Algorithms for Kids
lessons.content:
Algorithms are step-by-step instructions to solve a problem.

ðŸ‘‰ Example: Steps to make a sandwich or play a game.
ðŸ‘‰ Helps plan and organize actions logically.

lessons.title: Introduction to the Internet
lessons.content:
The Internet connects computers worldwide.

ðŸ‘‰ Use browsers to search for information.
ðŸ‘‰ Communicate via email or messaging.
ðŸ‘‰ Always ask an adult before visiting new websites.

lessons.title: Working with Files
lessons.content:
Files store your work on the computer.

ðŸ‘‰ To **open a file**, double-click it.
ðŸ‘‰ To **save a file**, use 'Save' or **Ctrl + S**.
ðŸ‘‰ Organize files in folders for easy access.

lessons.title: Using the Internet
lessons.content:
The internet is a tool to find information and communicate.

ðŸ‘‰ Use search engines to locate resources.
ðŸ‘‰ Watch educational videos.
ðŸ‘‰ Practice safe browsing habits and do not share passwords.
